paragraph.paragraph: A project's properties specify how a project is ../../../compiling_projects/index.xmlBuilt and ../../../debugging/index.xmlDebugged. EiffelEnvision splits project configuration's into two factions: Common Properties and Configuration Properties.
Project build configurations can be added, removed and edited through the vxurfConfigurationManagerDialogBoxS 0 Configuration Manager dialog box.

EiffelEnvision property pages are only available when the project is selected in Solution Explorer; property pages are not available for individual files for a EiffelEnvision project. However, you can access a file's properties in the Properties window.

To access project properties:
With a project selected in vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog 0 Solution Explorer , click the Project, <ProjectName> Properties menu.
Notice the two folders in the EiffelEnvision project's Property Pages dialog box: Common Properties and Configuration Properties. Only the properties in Configuration Properties can be set by project configuration.
Using the Configuration drop-down list box and with the Configuration Properties folder selected, select the configuration for which you want to set this project's properties. If you have the Common Properties folder selected, the Configuration drop-down list box is unavailable.
In the left pane, select a folder and property page.
In the right pane, set the available properties.
Click OK to save the settings. If you want a change to take effect immediately, click Apply.
Note: Properties that are grayed are defined when the project is created; they are displayed for information only.
Properties are saved in the project's .eifp file

A small amount of help is available in the descriptions pane beneath the project properties. Some of the descriptions begin with [Rebuild Required]. This indicates changing the property and clicking Apply will rebuild the entire project. Properties marked in this way require a project be rebuilt from scratch instead of the regular incremental compilation to make the changes take affect.
